rsbNotes.title: Ps 97:1
rsbNotes.text:
97:1 The Lord reigns. For God as King, see note Ps. 93:1.

the earth. The psalm calls on all the earth to praise God. This call to the nations has taken on a whole new meaning after the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 97:2–3
rsbNotes.text: 97:2, 3 Clouds . . . darkness . . . fire. See Ps. 18 and 29. The visible revelation of God (i.e., in theophany) was sometimes in the context of a storm-like event. Such a manifestation helped God’s people to appreciate His awesome power.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 97:5
rsbNotes.text: 97:5 mountains. See note Ps. 46:2, 3.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 97:7
rsbNotes.text: 97:7 who make their boast . . . idols. See Ps. 96:4–6.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 97:8
rsbNotes.text: 97:8 because of your judgments. The people of God know that the judgments of God will remove the wicked and so bring about their own liberation.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 98 A royal psalm, like Ps. 47; 93; 95; 96; 97; 99. The theme of deliverance is divided into past (vv. 1–3), present (vv. 4–6), and future (vv. 7–9).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98:1
rsbNotes.text:
98:1 a new song. See “Music in the Church” at Col. 3:16.

marvelous things. This phrase translated “wonderful deeds” in Ps. 9:1 (see note there).

worked salvation. In its Old Testament context the reference is to a military victory. It is appropriate today to apply the verse to a spiritual victory, since it is a great victory by God over “the cosmic powers” (Eph. 6:12).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98:3
rsbNotes.text: 98:3 has remembered. More than mere memory, God’s remembrance includes His favorable action.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98:4
rsbNotes.text: 98:4 Make a joyful noise. This section demonstrates the enthusiastic worship of a people who have deep love for God. Their worship is active and noisy.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98:7
rsbNotes.text: 98:7 the sea. Nature is here personified as praising the Lord. He is Creator of all, animate and inanimate (Ps. 95:5).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98:8
rsbNotes.text: 98:8 the rivers . . . the hills. See note on v. 7 and on Ps. 46:2, 3.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 98:9
rsbNotes.text: 98:9 judge . . . with equity. See note Ps. 96:10.
